metadata.Title: CVE-2022-21166 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Incomplete cleanup in specific special register write operations for some Intel(R) Processors may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable information disclosure via local access. It was discovered that some Intel processors did not properly perform cleanup during specific special register write operations. A local attacker could possibly use this to expose sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-21166` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

intel-microcode - 3.20220510.0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-120-generic - 5.4.0-120.136
linux-image-5.4.0-120-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-120.136
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-120-generic - 5.4.0-120.136
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-120-lowlatency - 5.4.0-120.136
No subscription required

criterions.comment: intel-microcode package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.20220510.0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
linux package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-120.136').
linux-aws package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1080.87').
